result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Townsend Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).
  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay the DNA surcharge, plus costs and disbursements from prison funds not to exceed 25%. Balance to be paid while on Extended supervision with supervision fees.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant which is a nondischargable in bankruptcy.

Restitution set at zero.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation and follow treatment recommended.

No contact with the victim Ms. Lauri R. or the Pick N Save located at 6300 S. 27 Street, City of Franklin, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.
No controlled substances or alcohol.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Anger management counseling.

AODA assessment, treatment.  Urine screens.
**Conditions apply to both counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor;  and further advised of voting ineligibilty.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to count one.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Townsend Jr

records.addlTxt: Signed Earned Release Program/Substance Abuse Program Order electronically transmitted to DOC.  jm
Amendment To Judgment Of Conviction And Order - ERP
DOC is requesting the Court to authorize the inmate's release and conversion of remaining confinement time to extended supervision.  Assigned to Br. 34, Judge Yamahiro.  jm

records.addlTxt: Per Order signed on 1/8/2015, count two:  I yr Initial Confinement and 2 years Extended supervision, consecutive to count one.
/to correct clerical error in Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Original transcript (39 Pages) commencing Sentencing HEARING 08/18/2014. Received and filed.
Original Transcript (39 pages) SENTENCING HEARING commencing August 18, 2014, received and filed.
/received and filed.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Jesse Townsend in court with attorney Alexis Ray Liggins.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pleah hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty of Counts 1 and 2 as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Parties request that the 8/18/14 date be used for sentencing.  The Court granted request and vacated the trial date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea date scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis Ray Liggins in court, defendant Jesse Townsend not in court, in custody.  Deann L. Heard, appearing for Lucy Kronforst,  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case unable to be heard on today's date.  Defendant not produced.
Court orders case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 20.
Jury trial remains on the court's calendar until the next court date.
Clerk:  jms
PROPOSED JURY INSTRUCTIONS, received and filed. lms
received and filed. lms
Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Attorney Alexis R Liggins in court, defendant Jesse Townsend not in court, in custody.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared by telephone for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel waives her client's appearance and requested a trial date.  Court set the following briefing schedule: movant must file by 6/18/14; response due by 7/08/14; reply due by 7/14/14.  All motions in limine, witness lists, and jury instructions are due within one (1) week of the final pretrial date.  (Alibi witnesses, if any, must be filed according to statute).   Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Jesse Townsend in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Jesse Townsend in custody.  Tyrone St. Junior for Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Yamahiro.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Moroney, Br. 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 29, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Laurie R.   
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Jesse Townsend in court with attorney Alexis R Liggins.  Defendant Jesse Townsend in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34. State moves to amend dates within the charging section of the complaint. Arguments heard. Court strikes the dates on the complaint. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
